questions.question_text: A wireless engineer must configure IEEE 802.1X authentication on a WLAN that supports new and legacy wireless devices. Which condition must be met for the legacy clients to be able to associate and authenticate without issues?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
For legacy clients to successfully associate and authenticate using IEEE 802.1X on a WLAN, the client and the authenticator (the Wireless LAN Controller or WLC) must support the same authentication protocol. This ensures that the authentication process can be completed without compatibility issues.

Key Points:
Authenticator: In a wireless network, the authenticator is typically the WLC or the access point (AP) that handles the 802.1X authentication process.

Authentication Protocol: Common protocols include EAP-TLS, PEAP, EAP-FAST, and others. The client and the authenticator must agree on a supported protocol for authentication to succeed.

Legacy Clients: Older devices may only support specific authentication protocols (e.g., PEAP or EAP-MD5), so the authenticator must also support these protocols to accommodate them.

The client and the authentication server must support the same authentication protocol. This is because the authentication server is responsible for verifying the clientâ€™s credentials during the authentication process. Therefore, it is essential that both the client and the authentication server support the same authentication protocol to ensure successful authentication.

Selected Answer: D
Spoto answer D

Selected Answer: D
Minsait is right
in this case the controller is the authenticator, so if B is correct the C is also correct which does not make sense

I think is D. EAP method is only defined on the client (supplicant) and RADIUS Server (Authentication Server). Not on the WLC/AP (Authenticator) from https://community.cisco.com/t5/wireless-mobility-knowledge-base/802-1x-eap-troubleshooting/ta-p/3155512

Selected Answer: B
Provided answer is correct. C. is also sometimes correct if the controller is the authenticator in a given situation but B. is the best answer.

choices.D: The client and the authentication server must support the same authentication protocol.
choices.B: The client and the authenticator must support the same authentication protocol.
choices.A: The authenticator and the authentication server must support the same authentication protocol.
choices.C: The client and the controller must support the same authentication protocol.

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring the maps on the Cisco Prime Infrastructure, but clients fail to show up on the maps. Which two actions are needed to complete this configuration? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C. Synchronize the network designs with the Cisco MSE: The network designs (maps) must be synchronized with the Cisco Mobility Services Engine (MSE) to ensure that client location data is accurately tracked and displayed.

D. Activate the context-aware service on the Cisco MSE: The context-aware service on the MSE is responsible for tracking client devices and providing location information. Activating this service is essential for clients to appear on the maps.

Why not the other options?
A. Install event group services in Cisco Prime Infrastructure: This is not related to client visibility on maps.

B. Synchronize the Cisco WLC with Cisco Prime Infrastructure: While synchronization between the WLC and Prime Infrastructure is important, it does not directly resolve the issue of clients not appearing on maps.

E. Install wIPS licenses on the Cisco MSE: wIPS (wireless Intrusion Prevention System) licenses are for security monitoring and are unrelated to client visibility on maps.

Thus, the two required actions are synchronizing the network designs with the Cisco MSE and activating the context-aware service on the Cisco MSE.

Selected Answer: BC
B. Synchronize the Cisco WLC with Cisco Prime Infrastructure.
C. Synchronize the network designs with the Cisco MSE.

Explanation:

A. Installing event group services in Cisco Prime Infrastructure is not directly related to displaying clients on maps.
B. Synchronizing the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) with Cisco Prime Infrastructure allows the Prime Infrastructure to gather data about connected clients and devices.
C. Synchronizing the network designs with the Cisco Mobility Services Engine (MSE) helps in mapping the physical network layout, including access points and controllers, to enable accurate client positioning on maps.
D. Activating the context-aware service on the Cisco MSE is not directly related to displaying clients on maps.
E. Installing wIPS (wireless Intrusion Prevention System) licenses on the Cisco MSE is not directly related to displaying clients on maps.

Selected Answer: BD
i go with BD .

choices.C: Synchronize the network designs with the Cisco MSE.
choices.A: Install event group services in Cisco Prime Infrastructure.
choices.E: Install wIPS licenses on the Cisco MSE.
choices.D: Activate the context-aware service on the Cisco MSE.
choices.B: Synchronize the Cisco WLC with Cisco Prime Infrastructure.
Install WLC software that supports the Hyperlocation module.
choices.D: Open SNMP port 161 and NMSP port 16113 on the controller.
choices.C: Use the same NTP server for syncing the time on the WLC, MSE, and PI.
choices.A: Enable DCA in the Global Configuration settings of the WLC.

questions.question_text: A network engineer is configuring a Cisco AireOS 8.2 WLC, Cisco MSE, and Cisco PI with Cisco 3700 Series APs and Cisco Hyperlocation modules. The engineer configures and enables a WLAN with Hyperlocation. During testing, the engineer notices that location accuracy is poor. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Time synchronization: For accurate location tracking, the WLC, MSE, and Cisco Prime Infrastructure (PI) must be synchronized to the same NTP (Network Time Protocol) server. Inconsistent time settings across these devices can lead to poor location accuracy.
spoto Answer B
C is correct. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-2/b_hyperLocation_best_practices_and_troubleshooting_guide.html

Selected Answer: C
. Use the same NTP server for syncing the time on the WLC, MSE, and PI.

questions.question_text: The IT department creates a video containing instructions for employees who have just joined the company. Newcomers need to join the wireless network named NEW4501999110. The WLAN name will be changed daily by IT support. Only new employees must receive the video over wireless multicast. What allows this feature?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
WMF (Wireless Multicast Forwarding): WMF optimizes multicast traffic delivery in wireless networks by converting multicast streams to unicast for individual clients. This ensures efficient delivery of multicast content (e.g., the video) only to the intended recipients (new employees).
A is correct. One of the worst questions I have seen over the years. Does Cisco really only want us to know acronyms?

Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/smb/wireless/cisco-small-business-300-series-wireless-access-points/smb5501-enable-wireless-multicast-forwarding-wmf-on-a-wireless-acces.html#:~:text=Wireless%20Multicast%20Forwarding%20(WMF)%20is,a%20wireless%20access%20point%20(WAP).

choices.A: Configure AVC on the controller to prioritize voice over other applications' traffic on the same device.
choices.D: Create mobility groups and include all the APs in the high-density areas.
choices.E: Turn off the 2.4 GHz radios on all APs where the voice application is used.
choices.C: Assign the Platinum QoS profile to the SSID carrying the new-style voice traffic.
choices.B: Remark all traffic coming from the new voice-capable devices with DSCP 46 (EF) at the AP.

questions.question_text: A municipality customer uses a Cisco 5520 Series Wireless Controller for the wireless network. The customer intends to move the depot of its stores from using legacy bespoke voice-over-Wi-Fi handsets to a VoIP software package running on 5 GHz-capable laptops, tablets, and smartphones. Bluetooth headsets will be used for any voice communication on any data device. Assuming that a suitable RF site survey for 5 GHz has already been carried out, which two configuration settings ensure the best possible voice experience? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
hint: at the AP is not possible, so AC are correct!

Selected Answer: BC
B. Remark all traffic coming from the new voice-capable devices with DSCP 46 (EF) at the AP: DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding, EF) is used to prioritize voice traffic. Remarking the traffic ensures that voice packets are given the highest priority across the network.

C. Assign the Platinum QoS profile to the SSID carrying the new-style voice traffic: The Platinum QoS profile is designed for real-time applications like voice and video, providing the lowest latency and highest priority for voice traffic.

comments.content:
so actually A C D are all correct. another stupid Cisco question


To ensure the best possible voice experience, the following configurations are required:

Remark all traffic coming from the new voice-capable devices with DSCP 46 (EF) at the AP:

This ensures that voice traffic is properly marked for prioritization.

Assign the Platinum QoS profile to the SSID carrying the new-style voice traffic:

This ensures that voice traffic is given the highest priority and lowest latency.

Configure AVC on the controller to prioritize voice over other applications' traffic on the same device:

AVC ensures that voice traffic is identified and prioritized, even when other applications are running on the same device.

To ensure the best voice experience, the network must:

Mark voice traffic with DSCP 46 (EF).

Assign the Platinum QoS profile to the SSID carrying voice traffic.

Configure AVC to prioritize voice traffic over other applications.

These steps, combined with proper RF optimization, will guarantee a high-quality voice experience for the municipality customer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
i think E is a valid option, since all laptops will be 5ghz capable and users will use bluetooth headsets for calls (which do operate on 2.4Ghz). i would rather say tunring Off 2.4Ghz which will be useless in case of migration to new solution would help.

Selected Answer: AC
A. Configuring AVC (Application Visibility and Control) on the controller to prioritize voice over other applications' traffic on the same device ensures that voice traffic receives the necessary priority for optimal performance. AVC allows the controller to identify different types of traffic and prioritize them accordingly.

C. Assigning the Platinum QoS profile to the SSID carrying the new-style voice traffic ensures that voice traffic is assigned the highest quality of service (QoS) profile, which helps in prioritizing voice packets over other types of traffic on the network.

Option B is not entirely relevant to the question since DSCP 46 (EF) is typically used for voice traffic, but remarking all traffic coming from the new voice-capable devices with DSCP 46 (EF) at the AP might not be necessary if the traffic is already marked correctly by the devices themselves.

I think C and E, why E "BLE headsets will be used for all communications", BLE is a know interferer in the 2.4 Ghz spectrum which may lead to a poor service for the VoWiFi users. Why would you remark all traffic as per B, we are only interested in QoS for the voice application

comments.content: Option E, turning off the 2.4 GHz radios on all APs where the voice application is used, might limit the coverage and flexibility of the network, especially if there are devices that only support 2.4 GHz. Moreover, it doesn't directly address voice traffic optimization.
The question says "BLE" headsets i.e. these operate in the 2.4 Ghz spectrum hence issues with RF interference may occur so turn it off, all network clients are 5 Ghz

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Types of control include the following:
- Marking of DSCP
Reference:
Official Cert Guide "CCNP Enterprise Wireless Design ENWLSD 300-425 and Implementation ENWLSI 300-430", Page 270
- Rate-limiting/policing traffic in the upstream or downstream direction
- Dropping certain traffic types
Answer A is not correct because AVC is used for marking, not for prioritization. Answer B may be correct if it is a Flexconnect deployment. I would go with B and C.

comments.content:
AVC - Types of control include the following:
- Marking of DSCP
- Rate-limiting/policing traffic in the upstream or downstream direction
- Dropping certain traffic types

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Platinum (packets are remarked to DSCP 46)

comments.content: Correct arra BC, B because AVC profiles only take effect on the WLC in the upstream direction.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A. Configure AVC on the controller to prioritize voice over other applications' traffic on the same device. - specifically allow only one application to have DSCP 46

C. Assign the Platinum QoS profile to the SSID carrying the new-style voice traffic. - ensures the ability to provide the best possible DSCP to voice traffic
